definition: (literary) to fracture (a bone)/(literary) to cut/to hack/variant of 銼|锉[cuo4]
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: The owner's name marked on this cigarette lighter has been filed away by the thief.
sentences.chinese: 主人刻在打火机上的姓名被小偷用锉刀锉掉了。

sentences.english: The branches of the date-palms look like files.
sentences.chinese: 海枣的枝子看起来象锉刀。

sentences.english: Time is the sound of the rasp.
sentences.chinese: 时间是没有声音的锉刀。

sentences.english: Mary is filing her nails with a file.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽正在用一把锉刀修指甲。

sentences.english: Q:What’s the best type of nail file?
sentences.chinese: 什么样的指甲锉刀比较好用？

sentences.english: It's made of the finest steel, no file could get through.
sentences.chinese: 那是用最好的钢制成的，没有锉刀能锉开。

sentences.english: He used a file to smooth the corner of the wood.
sentences.chinese: 他用锉刀把木材的边角磨平了。

sentences.english: Lin Jiayan filed Xiao Meng's finger nails after he cut them.
sentences.chinese: 林加彦剪完肖蒙的指甲后用锉刀把它们挫平。

sentences.english: After trimming, round off the edges with a filer.
sentences.chinese: 在修剪后，用锉刀把指甲边缘弄整齐。

definition: a saw/to cut with a saw
